As highlighted in bug 1611435 comment 1, the pipeline expects pings to be gzipped before being sent.

The Glean SDK doesn't currently do that, but it should.

Jeff, you mentioned that as an expectation for the pipeline. Why is that important on the pipeline side?

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Alessio Placitelli [:Dexter] from comment #0)
> Jeff, you mentioned that as an expectation for the pipeline. Why is that important on the pipeline side?

It's good for saving client bandwidth and it's good for saving some cost on the pipeline side in terms of having fewer bytes to move around in the first few hops of the pipeline before we've parsed the payload. So it's an expectation only in the sense that if the client _can_ gzip the payload, it's good for everyone if they do.
